alert.note: Alert for Clay (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 3:31AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Henry and northwestern Clay Counties through 400 AM EST/300 AM CST/... At 331 AM EST/231 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Texasville, or 8 miles northwest of Abbeville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Days Crossroads, Walter F George Lake, Edwin, Standleys Store, Otho, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Moores Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Graball, Screamer, Coates, Bagby State Park, Thomas Mill Creek, Lawrenceville and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
